page.title: 08FEATURES PAST & PRESENT
page.content: {PRINCIPAL FEATURES PAST & PRESENT { }THE FENS The Fens are like a big washing up basin in between Peterborough and Downham Market. Outwell is in the middle of the Fens. Over the years the Fens has been drained out,to leave Peat at the bottom. Peat is good for farming. The Fens have some of the best farming land in England. Lots of people helped to drain the fens. One man called Vermuyden built cuts. He built a cut called the Old Bedford that ran off the Ouse. When they opened it, it flooded so he built another cut nearby called the New Bedford river. The flooded area inbetween the two cuts are called the Washes. In 1830 some people knocked some iron poles into the ground at Holme Fen so you could only see the top of the poles.
